availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Larry T. Burton (Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Martha Burton. Father of Mary Burton, William Burton, Elizabeth "Betsy" A. Burton, Susan Burton, John W. Burton, James Burton, Louisa Burton, Doctor F. P. Burton, Amanda Burton, James M. Burton, and Jesse Burton. House carpenter in Granville County, North Carolina, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Granville County, Ledge of Rock, p. 150B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 618.
"Larry T. Burton (1819-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial #64510784, accessed December 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64510784.
